timeline.message:
Add support for the AT-PRO3HD66M

Signed-off-by: Michael Lobstein <michael.lobstein@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
private static final Set<ThingTypeUID> SUPPORTED_THING_TYPES_UIDS = Collections
.unmodifiableSet(Stream.of(THING_TYPE_PRO3_44M, THING_TYPE_PRO3_66M, THING_TYPE_PRO3_88M,
THING_TYPE_PRO3_1616M, THING_TYPE_PRO3HD_66M).collect(Collectors.toSet()));
private static final Set<ThingTypeUID> SUPPORTED_THING_TYPES_UIDS = Set.of(THING_TYPE_PRO3_44M, THING_TYPE_PRO3_66M, THING_TYPE_PRO3_88M,THING_TYPE_PRO3_1616M, THING_TYPE_PRO3HD_66M);
timeline.author: J-N-K

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
String loginHD() throws Exception {
String loginHD() throws IOException {
timeline.author: J-N-K

replies.bodyText: This whole method looks very much the same as loginHD. Do you think it is possible to have a common login(boolean isUHD) whis is called from loginHD and loginUHD and takes care of the differences?
replies.author: J-N-K

replies.bodyText: I tried to do it in one method but the logic was complicated. I do not have the other model to test with so I decided to make a separate method to avoid breaking the core functionality of the binding.
replies.author: mlobstein

timeline.body: Please do not catch `Exception`. I assume `IOException` is enough. Catching `Exception` also catches NPE and hides programming errors.
timeline.bodyText: Please do not catch Exception. I assume IOException is enough. Catching Exception also catches NPE and hides programming errors.
timeline.bodyHTML: Please do not catch Exception. I assume IOException is enough. Catching Exception also catches NPE and hides programming errors.
timeline.author: J-N-K

replies.bodyText: I completely agree. However in this instance, the exception being caught is explicitly thrown as Exception in getResponse() on lines 1260 & 1262. I could change those to be IOException or a custom exception. What do you think?
replies.author: mlobstein

replies.bodyText: I just looked at the rest of the code. This should never have been merged. Removing the Exception here will require some bigger refactoring, which is clearly out of scope here. Leave it as is.
replies.author: J-N-K

timeline.author: J-N-K
